Devotional 17 February 2025

February 17, 2025 â€¢ Steve Torres

Revelation 6:1-2 ESV â€œNow I watched when the Lamb opened one of the seven seals, and I heard one of the four living creatures say with a voice like thunder, â€œCome!â€ [2] And I looked, and behold, a white horse! And its rider had a bow, and a crown was given to him, and he came out conquering, and to conquer.â€

When Jesus begins opening the seals, He is not merely revealing the futureâ€”He is unveiling the will of God for all of history. The scroll, sealed until now, represents Godâ€™s divine decree, His sovereign plan that had been hidden but is now executed by the Lamb. This aligns with Hebrews 9:16-17, which explains that a will (or covenant) only takes effect after the death of the one who made it. â€œFor where a will is involved, the death of the one who made it must be established. For a will takes effect only at death, since it is not in force as long as the one who made it is alive.â€ Christ, through His death, has not only secured redemption but has also activated the revealing of Godâ€™s eternal decree.

The first seal brings forth a rider on a white horse, a symbol of conquest. This rider does not act outside of Christâ€™s authorityâ€”he is sent forth as part of the divine plan. Just as no power rises or falls apart from Godâ€™s will (Daniel 2:21), so too does this conqueror ride forth under sovereign decree. The four living creatures, who proclaim â€œCome!â€ represent Godâ€™s omniscient presence in history, ensuring that all unfolds according to His perfect knowledge.

What awe this should inspire in us! Christ is not a passive observer; He holds the scroll and commands history itself. His death did not merely saveâ€”it also inaugurated the revelation of Godâ€™s will. As the seals are broken, we are reminded that nothing in this world, no ruler, no kingdom, and no event, is beyond the authority of the risen Lamb. â€œThe LORD has established his throne in the heavens, and his kingdom rules over allâ€ (Psalm 103:19). Let us live with confidence, knowing that the same Lamb who redeemed us is the One guiding all of history in His perfect plan.
